intro: Cerastium brevicarpicum, commonly known as the short-carpelled mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and chickweed. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from April to May. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern and are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Cerastium brevicarpicum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
